definition: Baruch (name)/Baruch, disciple of Jeremiah/book of Baruch in the Apocrypha
Ba state during Zhou dynasty (in east of modern Sichuan)/abbr. for east Sichuan or Chongqing/surname Ba/abbr. for Palestine or Palestinian/abbr. for Pakistan

to long for/to wish/to cling to/to stick to/sth that sticks/close to/next to/spread open/informal abbr. for bus 巴士[ba1 shi4]/bar (unit of pressure)/nominalizing suffix on certain nouns, such as 尾巴[wei3 ba5], tail

sentences.english: So Baruch the son of Neriah took the roll in his hand, and came unto them.
sentences.chinese: 尼利亞的兒子巴錄就把書卷親自帶到他們那裏。

sentences.english: After him Pedaiah the son of Parosh.
sentences.chinese: 其次是巴錄的兒子毗大雅修造。

sentences.english: So Baruch the son of Neriah took the roll in his hand, and came unto them.
sentences.chinese: 尼利亞的兒子巴錄就手拿書卷來到他們那裏。

sentences.english: And Jeremiah commanded Baruch, saying, I am shut up; I cannot go into the house of the LORD
sentences.chinese: 耶利米吩咐巴錄說，我被拘管，不能進耶和華的殿。
